Context: The Centre for Community Services and Early Childhood at George Brown College offers certificates, diplomas, degrees, and postgraduate studies in community services, early childhood education, Deaf and Deafblind Studies, and Social & Community Services. Their programs include specialized skills training in American Sign Language, two-hand manual, and braille. The School of Early Childhood provides programming at various stages of careers. Students can practice job skills through field education opportunities in at least one program. There are 12 GTA lab school child care centres run by the college, making it Ontario's largest network of college-run child care facilities. George Brown College has partnerships across the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). For more information, contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca or visit their Social Media Hub. Phone: 416-415-2000; TTY: 1-877-515-5559. The college's website information is subject to change without notice and should not be considered a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
